question: Which one of the following functions of the Reserve Bank of India is not performed by the other banks?
option4: Acting as the banker to the Government
answer: Acting as the banker to the Government
explanation: The RBI acts as banker to the government the Central as well as state governments. As such, it transacts all banking business of the government, which involves the receipt and payment of money on behalf of the government and carrying out of its exchange, remittance and other banking operations.
